sources.title: Brighton Rock (1948, UK) Directed by John Boulting, Starring Richard Attenborough, Carol Marsh, Hermione Baddeley
sources.description: Brighton Rock is a 1948 British film directed by John Boulting and starring Richard Attenborough as violent gang leader Pinkie Brown (reprising his breakthrough West End creation of the character some three years earlier), Carol Marsh as the innocent girl he marries, and Hermione Baddeley as an amateur sleuth investigating a murder he committed. The film was adapted from the 1938 novel Brighton Rock by Graham Greene, and was produced by Roy Boulting through the Boulting brothers' production company Charter Film Productions. It was later released in the United States under the title Young Scarface . You can find out more about this movie from Wikipedia and Film Nolr of the Week . Suggested Film Noirs: http://bit.ly/2tLevkl Suggested British Film Noirs: http://bit.ly/3aMND3

metadata.Plot: Pinkie's a small-town hood who's trying to carve out a place for his gang in the Brighton rackets. When he murders a journalist he believes was responsible for the death of a fellow gang-member, Ida Arnold, who was with the man just before he died, sets out to find the truth.
metadata.Actors: Richard Attenborough, Hermione Baddeley, William Hartnell
